video.font



struct Glyph;
Immutable font glyph structure.

class Font;
Stores one font with one size (e.g. Inconsolata size 16 and 18 will be two Font objects).

this(FT_Library freetype_lib, string name, uint size, uint fast_glyphs, bool antialiasing);
Load font with specified name, size and number of fast glyphs.

Params:
FT_Library freetype_lib Handle to freetype library used to work with fonts.
string name Name of the font (file name in the fonts/ directory)
uint size Size of the font in points.
uint fast_glyphs Number of glyphs to store in faster accessible data, from glyph 0. E.g. 128 means 0-127, i.e. ASCII.
bool antialiasing Should the font be antialiased?

Throws:
Exception if the font could not be loaded.

uint size();
Returns size of the font in pixels.

uint height();
Returns height of the font in pixels. (currently the same as size)

string name();
Returns name of the font.

bool kerning();
Does the font support kerning?

FT_Face font_face();
Returns FreeType font face of the font.

void die();
Destroy the font and free its resources. To free all used resources, delete_textures must be called before this.

void unload_textures(VideoDriver driver);
Delete glyph textures.

Textures have to be reloaded before any further glyph rendering with the font.

Params:
VideoDriver driver Video driver used to delete the textures.

void reload_textures(VideoDriver driver);
Load glyph textures back to video driver.

Can only be used after textures were unloaded.

Params:
VideoDriver driver Video driver used to delete the textures.

package uint text_width(string str, bool use_kerning);
Returns width of text as it would be drawn.

Params:
string str Text to measure.
bool use_kerning Should kerning be used? Should only be true if the font supports kerning.

Returns:
Width of the text in pixels.

package Glyph* get_glyph(dchar c);
Access glyph for specified (UTF-32) character.

The glyph has to be loaded, otherwise a call to get_glyph will result in undefined behavior.

Params:
dchar c Character to get glyph for.

Returns:
Glyph corresponding to the character.

package bool has_glyph(dchar c);
Determines if glyph for the specified character is loaded.

Params:
dchar c Character to check for.

Returns:
True if the glyph is loaded, false otherwise.

package void load_glyph(VideoDriver driver, dchar c);
Load glyph for specified character.

Will render the glyph and create a texture for it.

Params:
VideoDriver driver Video driver to use for texture creation.
dchar c Character to load glyph for.

Page generated by Ddoc.
